list.abs: then the bold pirate had his first mate murder the other buccaneers so they would not have to share the treasure with them .然后大胆的海盗，他大副谋杀其他海盗这样他们就不会分享珍惜他们。
This was the island where buccaneers hid their loot ., 这是过去海盗们藏赃物的岛屿.
it seemed a thing so hopeless he was asking-he , the old buccaneer , the ringleader throughout .像他这么一个老海盗，一个彻头彻尾的叛乱头子，居然会提出希望这么渺茫的要求。
Would she suddenly take to buccaneer boots , some totem - crested helm , long - bladed dirks and throwing knives ?, 她会不会突然喜欢上海盗靴 , 带图腾顶饰的帽子 , 带长刃的匕首和飞刀?

entry.tran: （尤指以赚钱为目的）热衷投机的
entry.def: If you describe someone as buccaneering, you mean that they enjoy being involved in risky or even dishonest activities, especially in order to make money.

example.tran: 一个喜欢投机的英国商人

means.word_mean: 1. robbery on the high seas; taking a ship away from the control of those who are legally entitled to it
